transportAdvice: Lucerne's compact old town and main attractions are highly walkable, with the lake promenade and historic bridges easily reached on foot from the train station. An efficient public transit network of buses and boats covers the wider city and lake region, and taxis are readily available though expensive.

weather.description: Cold and often grey with occasional snow, making for a quiet and atmospheric winter visit.
Still cold with a chance of snow, though daylight hours begin to lengthen noticeably.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and occasional sunny spells between rain showers.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming landscapes, though rain remains fairly common.
Warm and green with frequent afternoon showers; one of the wetter months of the year.
Early summer is warm and lush but expect regular thunderstorms, especially in the afternoons.
The warmest month with long sunny days and ideal conditions for lake and mountain activities.
Warm and sunny with occasional thunderstorms; peak season with the most visitors.
Early autumn brings comfortable temperatures and beautiful golden light over the lake and Alps.
Cooler and increasingly misty, with autumn foliage adding colour to the surrounding hills.
Grey and damp with dropping temperatures; fog over the lake is common this month.
Cold and festive with Christmas markets in the old town and a chance of snow adding charm.
